result.execSummary:
The defendant Manuel A Moctezuma was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of Out-of-State Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$250.00 DNA surcharge, plus a 5% surcharge of $27.03 to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

10:44 AM Defendant Manuel A Moctezuma in court.  Attorney Nicholas R White in court for Manuel A Moctezuma.  Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. CH - Clerk 10:45 am Felony warnings given. Ct. 1 - Possession of firearm - guilty plea. CT. finds DE FVI&K enters plea. Ct. accepts plea, adj. guilty. DE waives PSI. Counsel stipulates to waiver. State makes recommendation. Arguments. DE makes statement. 

SENTENCE: w/h - 18 months probation, $10.00 fine/costs - totaling $290.60, $250.00 DNA SC/Sample, 5% SC on total amount payable to COC. May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. 2 days credit. Must report to probation by end of day today. PCR. 11:07 am adj.
